data.title: Sahasam (2013)
data.meta_description: Gowtam is a guard employed by a security agency. One rainy night, he finds out that his grandfather has a treasure stashed away in Pakistan which was his place before partition happened. Srinidhi is a staunch devotee and her goal is to visit a Hindu temple which is located in Hinglaj, Pakistan. Gowtam’s treasure is located in and around that temple. Gowtam joins Srinidhi’s journey to Pakistan temple where they have a security guy (Ali) helping them. Meanwhile, Sultan takes over the Pakistan’s archeology department’s team that is searching for treasure in the same area. The rest of the story is all about how Gowtam manages to get hold of diamonds which rightfully belongs to him.
data.text:
Chandrasekhar Yeleti is one of the better directors of Telugu film industry. He started with Aithe, a brilliantly done realistic crime movie. He followed it up with Anukokunda Oka Roju, a film which I believe is the best thriller to be ever released in Telugu. However from thereon, for commercial reasons I suppose, he had to mend his ways to play to the market and since then his films have never reached the same level of mastery shown earlier.

Sahasam, a treasure hunt leading the protagonist to Pakistan, is a unique story for Telugu no doubt. It is still better than run-of-the-mill no brainer masala affairs being mass produced for the masses in Telugu currently. That said, this movie runs…
